chargeHist.descr: Identity Theft - Obtain Money or Credit

result.execSummary:
The defendant Davor Jelic was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Unauthorized Use Of An Entity's Identifying Information Or Documents, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.203(2)(a).
  • Take and Drive Vehicle Without Owner's Consent-Abandon Vehicle., a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3m).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes:
Contact probation & parole 48 hours upon release from custody.
Probation review hearing December 1, 2022 at 9:00 a.m.

miscConds.notes: Restitution set at $500.00 to be paid first.  Payable to V.S. within 3 years or civil judgment.

Provide a DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge within 3 years or civil judgment.
Court waived all other mandatory and nonmandatory costs due to the inability to pay.

Pay supervision fees as determined by the agent.
Attend treatment and counseling programs determined by agent.
AODA evaluation. Maintain absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.

No contact with victims R.J. and M.J. without the approval of the agent or the Court.
No contact with victim V.S.
No contact with firearms.

Defendant advised as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.
Defendant advised he may not vote until his civil rights are restored.

timeConds.notes: Imposed and stayed pending probation review hearing.

records.addlTxt:
COUNT 1:  COURT ORDERED: 
Defendant to serve 12 MONTHS  in the House of Correction with credit for Zero days time served.   
Court Imposed and Stayed the sentence and placed defendant on Probation for 3 Years.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
120 Days Condition Time Imposed and Stayed pending a probation Review Hearing.
Restitution set at $500.00( to be paid first). Payable to VS within 3 Years or Civil Judgment.
Provide DNA sample and Pay DNA surcharge within 3 years Or Civil Judgment.  
Pay Supervision fees as determined by the agent. 
Court waived all other mandatory and non mandatory costs due to the inability to pay. 
Contact Probation & Parole 48 Hours upon release from custody.
AODA evaluation 
Attend Treatment and counseling programs determined by agent.
Maintain Absolute sobriety.
Random Urine Screens.
Obtain/Maintain Employment or attend school.
No Contact with Victims RJ and MJ without the approval of the agent or the court.
No Contact with Victim : VS
NO Contact with Firearms. 
Defendant advised as a  convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.
Defendant advised he/she may not vote until his civil rights are restored 
Appellate rights

 

AS TO COUNT 2: -   COURT ORDERED: 
Defendant to serve 164 DAYS  in the House of Correction, with  credit for  164 DAYS.  
Court ordered a TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

DNA surcharge Imposed and due within 3 years.  Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment. 
Court waives all other non mandatory and mandatory costs, fees and surcharges  due to the inability to pay.
Appellate rights given.

Probation Review Hearing scheduled December 1, 2022 at 9:00am.

Defendant Davor Jelic in court, in custody.  
Attorney John Mathew Krejci in court for Davor Jelic.  
Attorney Erika Strebel in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a Plea and Sentencing.  
State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law.
Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. 
Court is in receipt Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum.  
Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant.
 
PLEA HEARING PROCEEDED: AS TO COUNT 1 AND COUNT 2 
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.   
Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea. 
Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  
Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and  he may not vote in any election until his  civil rights are restored. 
Court orders defendant provide a DNA sample and advised defendant of applicable surcharge. 


AS TO COUNT 3
Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Charge DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

Case proceeds to sentencing.
Received and Filed. Crime Victim Rights form
Received and filed: DEFENDANT'S Proposed Jury Instructions.

Defendant Davor Jelic in court, in custody.  
Attorney John Mathew Krejci in court for Davor Jelic.  
Attorney Erika Strebel in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court on defense motion to modify bail.
State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. 
Bail bond hearing proceeded.   
Arguments heard by defense and the State. Court DENIED defense bail motion for reasons placed on the record
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19. 
Case remains calendared for a Plea and Sentencing on September 22, 2022 at 3:30pm.
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion for Bail Reduction.  (Davor Jelic - #2022004467, House of Correction, 8885 S 68th St, Franklin WI 53132).
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion for Bail Reduction.  (Davor Jelic - #2022004467, House of Correction, 8885 S 68th St, Franklin WI 53132).

Attorney John Mathew Krejci in court, defendant Davor Jelic not in court, in custody, appearance waived.  William R. F. Ackell appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Krejci appeared by video means. Defense is requesting a plea and sentencing date.  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 6, Judge Ellen Brostrom, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Davor Jelic in court with Attorney John Mathew Krejci; both appear by video.  Defendant Davor Jelic in custody.  Erika Strebel appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Franklin Officer C. Itnyre.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 45.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
No Contact Order signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Radivoje J, Nada J, Or their residence.  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Davor Jelic in court with attorney Alejandro A Lockwood.  Defendant Davor Jelic in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Davor Jelic appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor counts 2 and 3.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
